byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: A precarious cease-fire took effect in parts of Yemen, in the first negotiated halt to hostilities since Saudi Arabia started a bombing campaign against the Houthi rebels in late March.

headline.print_headline: A Cease-Fire in Yemen, but Fighting Is Persistent
headline.main: A Cease-Fire in Yemen, but Fighting Is Persistent

snippet: A precarious cease-fire took effect in parts of Yemen, in the first negotiated halt to hostilities since Saudi Arabia started a bombing campaign against the Houthi rebels in late March.
abstract: Tentative cease-fire takes effect in parts of Yemen, in first negotiated halt to hostilities since Saudi Arabia started a bombing campaign against Houthi rebels in late March.
